title: How to Copy an Image from a PDF

steps.title: Open Acrobat Reader.
steps.content: Open Acrobat Reader. Adobe Acrobat Reader DC is a free PDF viewer from Adobe. Depending on the type of PDF you downloaded, you may be able to select and copy the text in the PDF from here. If you don't have Adobe Reader yet, you can download and install it for free from https://get.adobe.com/reader/ . This software works for both Mac and Windows computers.

steps.title: Open the PDF file.
steps.content: Open the PDF file. You can do this by clicking the File tab, then click Open in the drop-down menu. If Adobe Reader is your default PDF program, just double-click the PDF file that you want to open to open it in Acrobat Reader.

steps.title: Click to select the picture in the PDF.
steps.content: Click to select the picture in the PDF. By default, the Selection tool should be active. If not, you can find this tool above the document page. It looks like a blue mouse cursor.

steps.title: Press Ctrl+C (Windows) or ⌘ Cmd+C.
steps.content: Press Ctrl + C (Windows) or ⌘ Cmd + C . The picture is copied to your clipboard and can be pasted anywhere, like in Microsoft Word. You can also click Copy from the Edit tab. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Open the PDF.
steps.content: Open the PDF. This method will take a screenshot of your PDF picture using the default screenshot tools on your Windows computer.

steps.title: Open Snipping Tool.
steps.content: Open Snipping Tool. You can type "Snipping Tool" in the search bar in the task menu to find this app, or you can find it in the app list in the Start Menu. Make sure you can easily see and select the corners of the PDF image in the background.

steps.title: Click the Mode tab.
steps.content: Click the Mode tab. You'll see this in the top left of the application window. A menu will dropdown.

steps.title: Click Rectangular Snip.
steps.content: Click Rectangular Snip . This will let you select the outline of the picture and screenshot that instead of the entire screen.

steps.title: Click the New tab.
steps.content: Click the New tab. Your screen will grey out and your cursor will look like cross-hairs.

steps.title: Click and drag the mouse over the picture in the PDF.
steps.content: Click and drag the mouse over the picture in the PDF.

steps.title: Press Ctrl+S and follow the on-screen prompts to save your screenshot.
steps.content: Press Ctrl + S and follow the on-screen prompts to save your screenshot. This saves your screenshot as an image file..

steps.title: Open the PDF.
steps.content: Open the PDF. This method will take a screenshot of your PDF picture using the default screenshot tools on your Mac computer.

steps.title: Open Preview.
steps.content: Open Preview. You'll find this in the Dock or by searching your Applications folder. Make sure you can easily see and select the corners of the PDF image in the background.

steps.title: Click the File tab.
steps.content: Click the File tab. You'll see this along the top of your screen.

steps.title: Hover over Take Screen Shot.
steps.content: Hover over Take Screen Shot . A menu will pop up to the right.

steps.title: Click From Selection.
steps.content: Click From Selection . Your screen will grey out and your cursor will look like crosshairs.

steps.title: Click and drag the mouse over the picture in the PDF.
steps.content: Click and drag the mouse over the picture in the PDF.

steps.title: Press Ctrl+S and follow the on-screen prompts to save your screenshot.
steps.content: Press Ctrl + S and follow the on-screen prompts to save your screenshot. This saves your screenshot as an image file.
